name: cardboard
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 material like very thick, stiff paper, usually pale brown in colour, used especially for making boxes: a cardboard box
kyoshino/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesHe was living on the streets for three months, and his home was a cardboard box.You can make your own distorting mirror by pasting a sheet of kitchen foil to a piece of thin cardboard.We made the figures out of cardboard.The children wanted a piece of cardboard to cut shapes from.

relating to something, usually a character in a film or play, that does not seem to be real or interesting: I've never enjoyed his plays - somehow all his characters are cardboard.

very thick, stiff paper, usually pale brown in color, used esp. for making boxes: She packed the books in a cardboard box.
